subject: Creativity
title: Psychological Safety: Why Teams Need Permission to Fail
description: A short lesson to help you apply Psychological Safety: Why Teams Need Permission to Fail.

hook.text: Google's Project Aristotle studied 180 teams. The #1 factor in creative performance? Psychological safety.

buildup.text: Psychological safety means team members feel safe to take risks, share wild ideas, and admit mistakes.

discovery.text: When people fear judgment, they self-censor â€” killing ideas before they're even spoken.

twist.text: The most creative teams aren't the smartest. They're the ones where nobody's afraid to look stupid.

climax.text: Pixar's 'Braintrust' meetings work because criticism targets the work, never the person. Safety is structural.

punchline.text: Great ideas need safe spaces before they need smart people.

quiz.question: What did Google's Project Aristotle find was the #1 factor in team creativity?
